title: How to Make Blackcurrant Lemonade

steps.headline: Pour a normal amount of blackcurrant cordial into a glass.
Fill the rest of the glass with blackcurrant cordial.
Pour a quarter glass of blackcurrant juice into a glass.
Fill the rest of the glass with blackcurrant cordial.
Pour the cup of water into the saucepan.
steps.description: Add the blackcurrants. Bring to the boil, then cook until the blackcurrants become soft.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Tip the mixture through a sieve or strainer to remove the fruit. Keep the juice.

steps.headline: Tip the juice into a saucepan.
steps.description: Add the sugar to the blackcurrant juice. Reheat. Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves in the liquid and the mixture thickens slightly.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat again.
steps.description: Pour the blackcurrant syrup into a jar. Place the lid on or seal, leave to cool and place in the refrigerator. This serves as the base for making lemonade from.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: To make one serving, simply add equal parts blackcurrant syrup with equal parts cold water and the juice from half a lemon.

text: Blackcurrant Cordial Lemonade Pour a normal amount of blackcurrant cordial into a glass.  Fill the rest of the glass with blackcurrant cordial.  Stir to mix. Add ice if preferred. Serve immediately. Garnish with a mint leaf (optional). Blackcurrant Juice Lemonade Pour a quarter glass of blackcurrant juice into a glass.  Fill the rest of the glass with blackcurrant cordial.  Stir to mix. Add ice if preferred. Serve immediately. Garnish with a mint leaf (optional). Old Fashioned Blackcurrant Lemonade Pour the cup of water into the saucepan. Add the blackcurrants. Bring to the boil, then cook until the blackcurrants become soft. Remove from the heat. Tip the mixture through a sieve or strainer to remove the fruit. Keep the juice. Tip the juice into a saucepan. Add the sugar to the blackcurrant juice. Reheat. Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves in the liquid and the mixture thickens slightly. Remove from the heat again. Pour the blackcurrant syrup into a jar. Place the lid on or seal, leave to cool and place in the refrigerator. This serves as the base for making lemonade from. Use as needed. To make one serving, simply add equal parts blackcurrant syrup with equal parts cold water and the juice from half a lemon.
